title: Routing Basics
body:
Next.js uses file-system routing. Files in the pages or app directory become routes.

Dynamic routes use brackets, such as /blog/[id]. Static generation can pre-build routes for SEO.

title: SSG vs SSR
body:
Static Site Generation (SSG) builds pages at compile time. Server-Side Rendering (SSR) builds on each request.

Use SSG for content that changes infrequently and SSR for data that must always be fresh.

title: API Routes and Middleware
body:
API routes run on the server. Middleware can check headers, enforce rate limits, and protect endpoints.

For sensitive endpoints, verify x-api-key or a session token before returning data.
